intro: Ornithogalum japonicum, commonly known as Japanese star-of-Bethlehem, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Japan and parts of Asia. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of star-shaped, white to pale purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and blooms in late spring to early summer. It is often found in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or shaded areas. The genus Ornithogalum is characterized by its milky sap and showy inflorescences, which are adapted for attracting pollinators.
